ai-ud2.5:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud2.5:1.3_0: Now at that time a certain lay follower from Icchānaṅgalaka arrived at Sāvatthī on some business.
ai-ud2.5:1.4_0: Having concluded his business in Sāvatthī he went to see the Buddha.
ai-ud2.5:1.5_0: The Buddha said this to him:
ai-ud2.5:1.6_0: “It’s been a long time, lay follower, since you took the opportunity to come here.”
ai-ud2.5:2.1_0: “For a long time I’ve wanted to come and see the Buddha, but I wasn’t able, being prevented by my many duties and responsibilities.”
ai-ud2.5:2.2_0: I wasn’t able to go to see the Buddha.”
ai-ud2.5:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.5:4.1_0: “One who has nothing is happy indeed,
ai-ud2.5:4.2_0: a learned person who has appraised the teaching.
ai-ud2.5:4.4_0: a person bound tight to people.”
